servinfo.title: Hard steering
servinfo.ptxt: Since the problems in steering involve several systems, they must all be considered when diagnosing a complaint. To avoid using the wrong symptom, always road test the vehicle first.
Proceed with the following preliminary inspections and correct any defects which are found.

s1.ptxt: Inspect tires for proper pressure and uneven wear.
Raise vehicle on a hoist and inspect steering system for loose or damaged parts.
Spin front wheels. Inspect for out-of-round tires, out-of-balance tires, bent rims, loosen and/or rough wheel bearings.

ps.ptxt: Bind in tie rod end ball studs or lower ball joints

action.ptxt: Replace tie rod end or front suspension control arm.

ps.ptxt: Low fluid level, loose drive belt or malfunction of power steering system

action.ptxt: Check and correct. Refer to P/S System Symptom Diagnosis .
